body.p: If you want to make each chapter independent (so it can be read separately, as a separate part of your publication), you need the make the page counter, figure, and table counters restart at each chapter - like in the following example for tables, where the chapter number is used to prefix each of the table title to avoid ambiguity:
body.codeblock: 1. First Chapter Table 1.1 Installation Table 1.2 Prerequisites 2. Second Chapter Table 2.1 Tools Table 2.2 Accessories 3. Third Chapter Table 3.1 Cleanup
body.p: The links between elements in different chapters also need to be changed. They have to display the chapter number before the page number to clearly specify the target.
To activate this feature you need to set the parameter args.css.param.numbering=deep-chapter-scope

This parameter will activate the built-in CSS rules from:
[PLUGIN_DIR]/css/print/p-numbering-deep.css
[PLUGIN_DIR]/css/print/p-numbering-deep-chapter-scope.css
